Commercial tobacco farming no longer occurs in Australia. Three tobacco manufacturing companies operate in Australia. The Commonwealth and state and territory governments have environmental and occupational health and safety legislation. regulation and policies in place to protect the environment and the health of persons in relation to the environment. Tobacco manufacturers are subject to these requirements.

column2:
From November 17 2011 in Bulgaria can offer only „cigarettes with reduced ignition propensity” or so-called „RIP cigarettes” (Reduced Ignition Propensity). All cigarettes at the market will have to conform the standard EN 16156:2010 on fire „Cigarettes. Evaluation of the ignition propensity. Safety requirement. „The standard was developed under a mandate from the European Commission and the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) and supports essential requirements for the general safety of products in accordance with Directive 2001/95/EC.
Compliance with the standard is mandatory for manufacturers and for retailers of tobacco products - cigarettes and supplies for RYO cigarettes. The conformity assessment of cigarettes will be evidenced by a document certifying the results of the laboratory tests of the burning ability of cigarette paper.
In Bulgaria requirements for fire safety about tobacco products are provided in Standard EN 16156:2010 „Cigarettes. Evaluation of the ignition propensity. Safety” in connection with BDS EN ISO 12863:2010 ”Standard method for assessing the ignition propensity of cigarettes” under the provisions of the Directive on general product safety 2001/95/EC of the European Parliament and the Council therefore that they are made of cigarette paper with a reduced ability of ignition..

 Se prohíbe fumar en los siguientes lugares incorpora en la letra b) y el número 4 respectivamente lo siguiente:

column2: The Tobacco Monopoly Administration is active in energy saving and emission reduction in the cigarette manufacturing process. Total industrial emissions of sulfur dioxide 3273 tons down 25.9%; total COD discharge the amount of 2316 tons down 8.5%.
column3: The State Tobacco Monopoly Administration has formulated and implemented the Assessment Standards of Clean Production for Cigarette Manufacturers Rules for Disposal of Wastes from Raw Materials of Tobacco and other relevant standards since 2006. Meanwhile the Administration actively pushed the energy saving and emission reduction in the course of cigarettes production. In 2009 the energy consumption per RMB10 000 output value for the tobacco industry was 34.6kg which represents a year-on-year drop of 12.6%; the energy consumption per 10 000 cigarettes was 4.08kg a year-on-year decrease of 6.0% the total emission of industrial sulfur dioxide was 10 098 tonnes a year-on-year decrease of 14.2% and the total emission of chemical oxygen demand was 6 886 tons a year-on-year decrease of 6.2%.
column4: The State Tobacco Monopoly Administration has formulated and implemented the Assessment Standards of Clean Production for Cigarette Manufacturers Rules for Disposal of Wastes from Raw Materials of Tobacco and other relevant standards since 2006. Rural Development programmes may grant an aid (per hectare) to compensate the loss of revenue for farmers (lower yield or higher costs) that implement more ''environment friendly'' practices. These practices cover different aspects of cultivation such as: set-aside areas areas not cultivated along rivers lake or wood; less use of fertilizers and/or pesticides; better irrigation…Aid may also be granted for training and exchange of experiences as well as for reforestation …These measures may indirectly protect health of the farmers and (seasonal) workers.
column3: Rural Development programmes may grant an aid (per hectare) to compensate the lost of revenue for farmers (lower yield or higher costs) that implement practices more environmental. In Italy we have no records of any environmental problem specifically related to tobacco growing which has lower impacts in terms of pollution and use of water than other comparable crops.
In Italy we have no records regarding cases of GTS or other illnesses specifically related to raw tobacco growing and processing

Tobacco Product (Control and Regulatory) Act 2011spells about the provision regarding disposal of the confiscated tobacco products which says;
(1) The authority hearing the case shall destroy the tobacco products confiscated as per this Act. 
(2) While destroying the tobacco products the authority shall destroy the tobacco products in a way that may not cause adverse effect on human health and the environment.
Besides this so far there is no policy that has been developed to address this issue.

column2: Occupation health and environmental protection measures

1.	Pakistan Tobacco Board keeps working with the different stakeholders to run programs that include training of farmers regarding safe use of pesticides integrated pest management and use of specially formulated fertilizer.
2.	Tobacco Control Cell is planning to collaborate with Pakistan Tobacco Board to raise the issue of protection of the health of tobacco cultivators.
3.	The following laws are applicable to tobacco manufacturing process in Pakistan:
a.	Pakistan Environmental Protection Act 1997 and National Environmental Quality Standards.
b.	Section 14 of Factory''s Act 1934 Factories Rules 1978 Electricity Rules 1937 and Boiler and Pressure Vessels Ordinance 2002.
column3:
1.	Pakistan Tobacco Board keeps working with the different stakeholders to run programs that include training of farmers regarding safe use of pesticides integrated pest management and use of specially formulated fertilizer.
2.	Government is considering collaboration of the Tobacco Control Cell with the Pakistan Tobacco Board to raise the issue of protection of the health of the persons involved in tobacco cultivation.
3.	The following laws are applicable to tobacco manufacturing process in Pakistan:
a.	Pakistan Environmental Protection Act 1997 and National Environmental Quality Standards.
b.	Section 14 of Factorys Act 1934 Factories Rules 1978 Electricity Rules 1937 and Boiler and Pressure Vessels Ordinance 2002.

In order to reduce morbidity and mortality caused by smoking and exposure to tobacco smoke for all population groups by implementing bans on smoking in public 
places and realization (up to 100%) of vacancies smoking measures have been planned including : developing social marketing strategies of exposure to tobacco smoke targeted at employers employees and the union the implementation of restrictions on smoking in public places and workplaces banning the marketing of tobacco products inside and in the neighbourhood of educational and health institutions developing materials for teachers in schools colleges and universities on the negative impact of smoking and exposure to tobacco smoke and their use in education institutions local authorities provide relevant information that will help implement local regulations prohibiting smoking in public places

column3:
In the National CEHAP (Childrens Environment and health Action Plan) 2009-2019 adopted in October 2009 the Regional Priority Goal III related to indoor air quality and one of the Mid-term objectives planned for 2012 is the adoption of laws and secondary legislation related to indoor air quality that is harmonized with EU regulations. Laws and regulations related to protection of the environment and health of children exposed to tobacco smoke have to be created according to this plan. 
Within the Mid-term activities - Project on reduction of tobacco use in young people and reduced exposure of children to second-hand tobacco smoke is planned with expected results in the reduced prevelence of tobacco use in young people also the redused exposure to environmental tobacco smoke.
Legislation that is in corelation with tobacco packaging is regulated through the Law on waste management and in the Law on package and packaging waste

column2: Thailand Tobacco Monopoly (TTM). a state enterprise operating under supervision of the Excise Department. Ministry of Finance adopted good argicultural practice (GAP) for cultivation and production of tobacco by aiming at reducing chemical residues to not exceed standard level as well as prohibits to use pesticides. Nevertheless. the practice are adopted to grow the three types of tobacco plants by the supervision of TTM. i.e.. Virginia. Burley. and Turkish.
column3: Thailand Tobacco Monopoly (TTM) a state enterprise operating under supervision of the Excise Department Ministry of Finance adopted good argicultural practice (GAP) for cultivation and production of tobacco by aiming at reducing chemical residues to not exceed standard level as well as prohibits to use pesticides. Nevertheless the practice are adopted to grow the three types of tobacco plants by the supervision of TTM i.e. virginia burley and tursky.
column4: Growing tobacco plants in Thailand must be allowed by the Excise Department of the Ministry of Finance especially growth of Virginia Burley and Turkish types. The quota for growing tobacco plants is under the supervision of Thailand Tobacco Monopoly (TTM) and private firms. Thus the amount and practices of tobacco farming are controlled by the domestic tobacco manufacturer in Thailand. In order to practice environmental safety the manufacturers have to implement Good Agricultural Practice (GAP) which restricts a safety level of the amount of chemical substances applied to plants or prohibits the use of insecticides pesticides. Nevertheless this particular practice is not totally comprehensible for all tobacco farming. As for domestic types of tobacco plants these are not covered by the supervision of TTM and private firms and so there are still usage of chemical substances for growing of these plants which can cause residues of these substances in the environment and may be harmful to farmers.
